item.title: Highly Anticipated Game Skipping Gamescom
item.description:
Highlights

  • Hollow Knight: Silksong won't be at Gamescom 2024.
  • The game was previously targeting an H1 2023 release but ended up being delayed.
  • Silksong aside, Gamescom 2024 is poised to boast a record number of exhibitors, more than 1,400 of them.

Hollow Knight: Silksong won't appear at Gamescom 2024 , an event representative has confirmed. While Team Cherry fans will hardly be happy with this omission, Silksong skipping Gamescom is far from surprising, as the game has been MIA for a while now.

First announced in February 2019, Silksong was originally envisioned as Hollow Knight DLC before the rapidly increasing scope of the project prompted Team Cherry to turn it into a standalone game. Since then, the developer announced that the much-anticipated metroidvania will be a day-one Xbox Game Pass release and confirmed its plans to bring it to the latest two generations of PlayStation consoles. And while it was previously targeting a release in the first half of 2023, the company indefinitely delayed Silksong in May of that year.

Hollow Knight: Silksong Skipping Gamescom 2024

Ever since then, fans have been speculating about the possibility of Silksong appearing at pretty much every major event that came and went in the meantime. Looking to get ahead of such chatter this time around, long-time Gamescom presenter Geoff Keighley has recently taken to Twitter to state that the Hollow Knight sequel will be skipping this year's edition of the show because Team Cherry "is still cooking." The move marks the second occasion on which Keighley tempered Gamescom expectations over the past 12 months, having also done so ahead of the 2023 edition of the convention.

As for Team Cherry's highly anticipated title, Hollow Knight: Silksong has already disappointed fans several times this year, one for each of the early summer game showcases that took place in June 2024. The lack of updates about the project's status has long been memed in the online community, which has been waiting for Silksong for over half a decade as of this writing.

Even though the Hollow Knight sequel is skipping the Cologne-based event, plenty of other games won't be. Gamescom 2024 is even expected to set a new record for the number of exhibitors, as over 1,400 developers and publishers from 64 countries will be presenting at the show, a 15% year-on-year increase. The convention has also reserved an unprecedented number of country pavilions, 48, which will be dedicated to 37 countries.

Gamescom will be preceded by its traditional Opening Night Live (ONL) announcement show hosted by Keighley, which is scheduled to take place on August 20, starting at 11am PT / 2pm ET / 8pm CET. The convention itself will run from August 21 to 25.

item.title: Diablo 4 Player Crafts Incredibly Rare Item
item.description:
Highlights

  • Mythic Uniques like the Harlequin Crest offer unparalleled power with high affix values in the game.
  • Crafting the Harlequin Crest in Diablo 4 is a rare stroke of luck for players seeking powerful items. However, one player was lucky enough to do so.
  • The Harlequin Crest, now reworked in Diablo 4, remains a coveted item among players for its impressive stats.

An incredibly lucky Diablo 4 player has crafted the Harlequin Crest after several attempts. Diablo 4 is known for the rich variety of items that players find on their adventures through Sanctuary, but some stand out for having an incredible impact on players' builds.

These are the Mythic Uniques, formerly known as Uber Uniques, which are among the most powerful items in Diablo 4 . There are currently eight Mythic Uniques in Diablo 4 , and the player who is lucky enough to get one will have an item with 925 power and the highest affix values possible. To grab one of these formidable pieces of gear, players can fight Tormented Bosses, defeat monsters from level 55 onwards, or gather Diablo 4 's materials to craft them. And thanks to this system, a Diablo 4 player now has one of the game's most powerful items.

Reddit user matt303277 is the latest Diablo 4 player to own a Harlequin Crest, this time gotten via crafting. They explained that they had been trying to get a Harlequin Crest with the Greater Affix of cooldown reduction "for a while," but without success. The player finally finished the quest for their Shako recently, obtaining the popular Diablo 4 item with an impressive 30% cooldown reduction. Other equally huge stats of the Mythic Unique item include 2,775 maximum life and 3,750 armor. By comparison, some of the item's base stats grant 1,850 maximum health and 2,500 armor.

Harlequin Crest is one of Diablo 4's Most Coveted Items

In the race to obtain Mythic Uniques, the Harlequin Crest is a popular choice among players. Considered one of the best Uniques in Diablo 4 , Shako is a general Mythic Unique item, meaning that players can equip the item regardless of the class they are playing. Previously, to use the Harlequin Crest, Diablo 4 players had to be level 35, a restriction removed after the item's rework. With the rework, Shako has become even more coveted because, coupled with the Greater Affix and Masterworking upgrades, players can achieve a whopping 54% cooldown reduction.

The Harlequin Crest remains one of Diablo 4 's most beloved items even after the rework, but this isn't the only recent change made to the itemization of Blizzard's RPG. In Season 5, Diablo 4 revamped all Unique items, including Mythic Uniques, spicing up the gameplay experience. For those who have yet to obtain Shako or another of these important items, players have discovered a new method of farming Mythics in Diablo 4 that could prove useful.

item.title: 10 Best RPGs That Are Isekai, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • RPGs like Cassette Beasts offer players immersive experiences in unknown worlds where adaptability and exploration are key.
  • Games like Digimon Survive delve into darker themes of survival and difficult choices, adding depth to traditional isekai narratives.
  • In Ni No Kuni 2, players follow a president's journey in a magical kingdom, blending isekai elements with rich gameplay mechanics.

The isekai genre, often associated with anime, involves characters being transported to unknown realities where they face new challenges and opportunities. In RPGs, many titles adopt a similar dynamic, taking protagonists to other realms and requiring them to adapt to new rules and explore unfamiliar environments.

Despite many of these games not adopting the typical anime aesthetics, several RPGs still capture the essence of isekai, utilizing this narrative to tell deep and immersive stories. These games challenge characters to adapt to new realities, offering unique and thrilling experiences that transcend the boundaries of the known.

10 Cassette Beasts

An Unexpected Journey

In Cassette Beasts , players are transported to the island of New Wirral, an unknown dimension full of dangers and mysteries. Here, the inhabitants use cassette tapes to transform into powerful creatures, facing the challenges this new world presents. The adaptation to this alternate reality is a central theme, exploring the struggle for survival and the search for a way back.

The monster fusion system is one of the game's pillars, allowing for unique combinations that result in more than 14,000 different forms. As players explore New Wirral, they must record new creatures, develop skills, and create strategies to win intense battles. Cassette Beasts offers a rich and engaging experience, blending traditional RPG elements with the essence of the isekai genre.

9 Magic Knight Rayearth

Sega Saturn's Classic Isekai Adventure

  • Platform: Sega Saturn
  • Developers: Working Designs, Sega, Overworks
  • Publishers: Sega
  • Genre: Action, Adventure, RPG

While many RPGs follow traditional formulas, Magic Knight Rayearth for the Sega Saturn stands out by adapting a classic isekai anime. The story follows three girls transported to the world of Cephiro, where they must adapt to their new reality and face epic challenges to save this magical realm from evil forces.

In the game, the protagonists explore dungeons, battle powerful enemies, and discover their own abilities, all while trying to find a way back home. Magic Knight Rayearth perfectly incorporates the elements of the isekai genre, offering an engaging narrative and RPG mechanics that retain the essence of the original anime, making it an excellent game.

8 Persona Q2: New Cinema Labyrinth

Persona Protagonists Unite In A New Adventure

The Persona franchise already flirts with isekai elements, transporting characters to supernatural worlds. In Persona Q2: New Cinema Labyrinth , these themes are intensified, bringing together protagonists from different games in the series in a new universe. Although they already possess powers, the heroes must adapt and join forces to face the challenges of this cinematic labyrinth.

In this spinoff for the Nintendo 3DS, players explore dungeons inspired by films, each with its own rules and dangers. The narrative, lighter than in the main games, highlights the interaction between iconic characters from different Persona eras as they face new enemies and unravel the mysteries of this alternate universe.

7 Undertale

A Modern Isekai That Defies RPG Expectations

Inspired by games like Earthbound , Undertale is one of the simplest and most enjoyable RPGs ever developed, where the protagonist, a child, falls into an underground hole filled with monsters and must adapt to this reality. The game also incorporates many popular elements from the isekai genre, forcing players to adapt to the rules of this new world.

Undertale offers an engaging narrative with complex characters, where choices and approaches result in different endings. The game subverts expectations by introducing mechanics that encourage peaceful alternatives to combat, challenging the player to adapt to an unknown world. This combination makes Undertale a modern example of isekai, shaping the protagonist's experience.

6 Kingdom Hearts

An Isekai RPG About "A Fish Out Of Water"

In Kingdom Hearts , Sora is whisked away from his island home, becoming separated from his friends as he's thrust into new worlds inspired by Disney stories. Each world presents its own unique rules and challenges, emphasizing the isekai element as Sora adapts to these unfamiliar realities, often feeling like a "fish out of water" in these strange, magical lands.

As the game progresses, however, the script lessens the need for adaptation, with Sora navigating the worlds without needing to follow specific rules. Despite this change, the first Kingdom Hearts still fits well within the isekai concept, with its initial premise and the constant sense of being in an unknown environment, maintaining the spirit of an adventure RPG.

5 Pokemon Legends Arceus

A Time Travel Mission in Pokemon Legends Arceus

Pokemon Mystery Dungeon wasn't the only time the franchise played with isekai elements, and in Pokemon Legends Arceus , the main characters are sent to the past by the God of Pokemon himself. Although his motivations are unclear, the journey to the Hisui region is both fun and one of the best spinoffs in the series.

Here, players are transported to a region in the past, where Pokemon were still more of a threat than a friend. Even the Pokedex , for example, had not been fully developed. In this game, which combines RPG elements with exploration, players must shape the future of the universe as it is known today.

4 Digimon Survive

One Of The Most Well-Known Isekai Franchises

Digimon is one of the franchises that best knows how to use standard isekai elements to create high-quality animations and RPG games, and in Digimon Survive , the story is no different, making it one of the best games in the franchise. Here, the game features tactical battles, but the majority of the gameplay focuses on text in a Visual Novel style.

In addition, Digimon Survive also brings more mature elements to the story, addressing themes such as survival, friendship, and difficult choices that directly impact the plot's development. The game stands out for its engaging narrative, combining the exploration of an unknown world in a darker tone than the standard of other games.

3 Final Fantasy Tactics Advance

Entering the World of Ivalice

Many universes created in video games are often perilous for their inhabitants, filled with dangers that many players have wondered what it would be like to live in these fantastical worlds. This is the theme of Final Fantasy Tactics Advance , where the protagonist, Marche, is transported from everyday life to the magical world of Ivalice. Inspired by a game he and his friends are familiar with, the world turns out to be more challenging than expected.

In Ivalice, Marche faces challenges beyond battles, dealing with the moral complexities of a seemingly perfect world but filled with hidden dangers. The game incorporates isekai elements, emphasizing the character's adaptation to new rules and the quest to return to the real world, while Marche learns about friendship and responsibility.

2 Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Rescue Team DX

The Game Where The Protagonist Becomes A Pokemon

Even though the main games in the Pokemon franchise follow the logic where players are trainers battling in gyms, the spinoffs explore more creative narratives. Pokemon Mystery Dungeon does this by taking characters on an isekai journey. Here, the human protagonist is transformed into a Pokemon , embarking on a new and challenging adventure.

In this new world, the protagonist must adapt to life as a Pokemon , forming teams with other creatures to explore mysterious dungeons and face various dangers. The plot explores the adaptation to a new reality, with the protagonist learning to live in this universe while seeking answers about their transformation and how to return to human form.

1 Ni No Kuni 2: Revenant Kingdom

A Story Of A President Transported To Another World

One of the most engaging games ever produced by Level-5, Ni no Kuni 2: Revenant Kingdom begins with the introduction of Roland Crane, a president of an unnamed nation on Earth, who is transported to the kingdom of Ding Dong Dell in a younger version of himself. Alongside Evan, the mission is to reclaim the lost throne.

Transported to this new reality, Roland must quickly adapt to the complexities of a magical world. Ni no Kuni 2 combines isekai elements with rich gameplay, allowing the exploration of vast kingdoms, participation in real-time battles, and the building of a new realm. The journey of adapting to this unknown universe makes the game a unique and immersive experience.

item.title: The 10 Best Offline PC Games
item.description: If you're yearning to return to a day where you could play PC games without an internet connection, then boy, do we have the list for you. We've compiled 10 of the best offline games you can play on PC.

item.title: Steam Deck: How To Play Game Boy Advance Games
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Requirements Before Installing Emulators On The Steam Deck
  • Download EmuDeck On The Steam Deck
  • Adding Game Boy Advance Games To The Steam Deck
  • Add Games With Steam ROM Manager
  • Playing GBA Games On The Steam Deck
  • Play GBA Games With Emulation Station

The Game Boy Advance was an amazing little handheld that was a vast improvement over the original Game Boy and the Game Boy Color. It boasted a bigger screen, better graphics, colors, and sound, and it was a huge success story for the Nintendo brand.

Unfortunately, many of the games in the GBA's vast library aren't playable on modern consoles, but thanks to emulators on the Steam Deck , you can play your favorite games on Valve's powerful handheld. This guide will detail how to install EmuDeck, install the GBA games, and add them to the Steam Deck's library along with your official Steam games.

Requirements Before Installing Emulators On The Steam Deck

Before running emulators such as EmuDeck , ensure you have configured your Steam Deck with the necessary tools and settings by using the following steps:

  • A fully charged, docked, or mains-connected Steam Deck.
  • A high-speed A2 microSD card to install EmuDeck and the games.
  • Alternatively, you can connect an external HDD/SSD with a Docking system for the Steam Deck. However, a microSD card keeps the Steam Deck portable.
  • Legally owned Game Boy Advance ROMS.

Game Boy Advance file names end with .gbc

Switch On Developer Mode

  • Press the Steam button .
  • Open the System menu and switch Developer Mode on.
  • Now open the Developer menu and switch CEF Debugging on.
  • Select the Power option.
  • Then select Switch to Desktop Mode.

Download EmuDeck On The Steam Deck

With the Steam Deck ready, it's time to switch over to Desktop Mode and download the necessary files to use EmuDeck, RetroArch, and the Steam ROM Manager.

  • Open a browser of your choice like Firefox, Chrome, or DuckDuckGo.
  • Download the launcher from the EmuDeck website.
  • Click the Steam OS version, and choose Custom Install.
  • With the EmuDeck startup process, opt for the SD Card image named Primary.
  • You can install all the emulators or select RetroArch, Emulation Station, and Steam Rom Manager and click Continue.
  • On the next screen, switch on Auto Save.
  • Skip the next few screens and select Finish to finalize the installation.

Adding Game Boy Advance Games To The Steam Deck

With EmuDeck installed, we can add your GBA ROMs to the correct folder using the following steps.

  • Ensure the Steam Deck is in Desktop Mode.
  • Open the Dolphin file manager and select the Primary under Removable Devices.
  • Open the Emulation.
  • Now open ROMS.
  • Then open the GBA folder.
  • Transfer your Game Boy Advance games into the GBA folder.
  • After the file transfer has finished, reopen EmuDeck.

GBA File Extension

Paste Folder Location

.gba

Removable Devices>Primary>Emulation>ROMS

Add Games With Steam ROM Manager

  • Select Yes to close the Steam client running in the background and tap Next.
  • Toggle Parsers off in the Parsers menu.
  • Activate the Game Boy Advance tabs.
  • Select Add Games.
  • Wait for the Steam ROM Manager to finish adding the games and their cover art to the Steam Library, then select Save to Steam.
  • Wait for the “Done adding/removing entries” box to close the Steam ROM Manager.
  • Exit EmuDeck and Return to Gaming Mode by tapping or clicking the desktop icon.

Playing GBA Games On The Steam Deck

With the Steam ROM Manager finished, it's time to switch back to Gaming Mode on the Steam Deck and play the games.

  • With the Steam Deck in Gaming Mode, press the Steam button.
  • Open the Library and press R1 to access the Collections tab .
  • Click on the Game Boy Advance window.
  • Select one of your GBA games and Play.

Play GBA Games With Emulation Station

Following the above steps, EmuDeck will also set up Emulation Station, providing an alternative method to enjoy your favorite Game Boy Advance games outside the Steam Deck's library, should you choose.

  • Press the Steam button and open the Library menu.
  • Slide to the Collections tab.
  • Select the Emulators square .
  • Open the Emulation Station window and select Play.
  • Scroll to the Game Boy Advance icon and press A to open it.
  • The games will be displayed in a list.
  • Launch a game by selecting it and pressing A.
  • Emulation Station incorporates RetroArch , allowing you to access and tailor your settings by pressing the Select and Y buttons.

Change The UI In Emulation Station

If you want Emulation Station to list your games with their boxart and metadata within the UI so they look more organized and presentable, use the following steps to change the presentation:

  • Open the Nintendo Game Boy Advance menu.
  • Press the Steam Deck's menu button - above the right analog stick.
  • Select Scraper.
  • For Scrape From, select TheGamesDB.
  • In Scrape These Systems, Select Game Boy Advance.
  • Select Back.
  • Open Content Settings and switch on Game Names, Other Metadata, Screenshot Images, Title Screen Images, Box Cover Images, Box Back Cover Images, and Marquee Wheel Images.
  • Then select Back and Start on the next screen.
  • Depending on how many games you have in your library, it may take some time to pull in all the required data.
  • Now you can navigate your game library through Emulation Station complete with box art and metadata.

That's everything needed to play Game Boy Advance games using the Steam Deck's main library or through Emulation Station's built-in UI. It's surprising how visually impressive GBA titles look with a fantastic library of RPGs and adventure games that stand the test of time.
